image.altText: A police officer guiding people at a shopping centre.

props.synopsis: A lockdown at an Adelaide shopping centre was the first test since the Bondi Junction attack on the response to large-scale public threats. But experts say more could be done within the private security sector.

title.children: After two incidents at major shopping centres, security experts say the industry is changing

image.altText: A collage of a black and white photo of the White House, lit at night, and elements of the US flag.

props.synopsis: Trump's march to re-take the White House continues with renewed determination. If he wins he'll have an "army" of 10,000 recruits at his disposal to help implement his controversial agenda.

title.children: The conservative 'battle plan' to give Trump unprecedented power

image.altText: A man with full beard and moustache stands agaainst a black background

props.synopsis: Donald Trump selects Ohio senator JD Vance as his running mate, at the beginning of a four-day Republican National Convention to confirm the party's presidential ticket.

title.children: JD Vance once called Trump 'America's Hitler'. Today he's his vice-presidential nominee

image.altText: Andrew Christodoulou  pic 2 by craig andrews

props.synopsis: The ATO has issued tens of thousands of director penalty notices that make people personally liable for debts, and is also more commonly using garnishee notices, which allow it to take money directly from a person's bank account or employer. That's sending more businesses under.

title.children: The ATO is cracking down on former company directors in a blitz some say will send them bankrupt

image.altText: CFMEU generic

props.synopsis: Senior government ministers will not say whether donations from the CFMEU's construction division should be banned amid allegations of criminal links.

title.children: Federal Labor coy on banning donations from embattled construction union

image.altText: a gas exploration well with drill rig and equipment.

props.synopsis: ANZ, NAB, Westpac and CommBank collectively loaned billions to companies such as Santos and Woodside to expand or operate oil, gas and coal projects.

title.children: Major banks lent $3.6b to fossil fuel projects in 2023 using a 'back door'

image.altText: An apartment building with 12 balconies facing the street

props.synopsis: Police have launched a Commissioner's Inquiry after a man wielding a sword threatened a woman inside her Mawson Lakes unit. Police subdued the man using a taser, and he was taken to hospital where he later died.

title.children: 'Extremely confronting scene': Woman injured, man dead after sword incident

image.altText: Donald Trump raises his fist while surrounded by secret service agents.

props.synopsis: Some may consider the shooting of Donald Trump to be a worrying sign of a new era of political violence but unfortunately George Bush senior and junior, Bill Clinton, Barack Obama and even Joe Biden have all faced security threats and attempted assassinations. It's what happens next that will define America.

title.children: In the aftermath of Trump's shooting one thing is clear: He's a uniquely talented politician

image.altText: Donald Trump with a bandage on his ear.

props.synopsis: As Joe Biden's first TV interview since the attempt on Donald Trump's life airs on NBC, the former president makes an unplanned appearance at the Republican National Convention. Follow live.

title.children: Trump makes surprise convention appearance as Biden's high-stakes interview airs

image.altText: A graphic showing a Medicare card, $100 bills, COVID cells and scientific beakers

props.synopsis: Some Australian pathology companies engaged in widespread and "systematic rorting" at the height of the COVID-19 pandemic, with new documents revealing accusations of fraud, cost-shifting and "opportunistic" claiming.

title.children: Doctor requested 21,000 COVID tests in a single day: How some pathology companies 'rorted' Medicare during the pandemic

image.altText: A man standing in front of vine leaves making a gesture with his hands on top of each other

props.synopsis: Two young women were waiting at a pedestrian crossing when they allegedly saw a man being stabbed and stomped to death, while CCTV captured the alleged murder weapon being tossed into a bike cage, a jury has been told.

title.children: Knife used in alleged CBD stabbing murder was thrown into cage, jury told

image.altText: A range of olive oils sit on a supermarket shelf.

props.synopsis: A patchy growing season across Australia is affecting an already tight market with olive oil prices expected to stay high. So should consumers buy up now before further price rises?

title.children: Heat on olive oil producers after a difficult season as growers offer consumers an important tip

image.altText: Jacinta Allan says she told Victoria Police about unlawful workplace behaviour

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has confirmed moves are underway to suspend the CFMEU's construction division from the state Labor branch, as she faces questions over her handling of previous allegations against the powerful union.

title.children: Victorian premier defends action on CFMEU allegations, says union suspension underway

image.altText: Inmate Male Image

props.synopsis: In this Broken Hill prison, 70 per cent of inmates identify as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander. The new jail manager decided it was time to prioritise their cultural care.

title.children: A remote NSW prison is changing the way it supports First Nations inmates

image.altText: A young girl lies on her back tpo create a 'snow angel'.

props.synopsis: Parts of New South Wales have woken to the landscape covered by a light blanket of snow and hopes more flurries will follow.

title.children: Snow chasers flock to NSW regions as cold snap brings flurries

image.altText: A man stands in a paddock holding a branch of dry, dead leaves with small dead trees around him.

props.synopsis: Dying and starving native trees are becoming more common across South Australia, Victoria and Tasmania after months of little rain.

title.children: Farmers report high numbers of dying, distressed native trees after record dry autumn

image.altText: The black metal gate of a housing estate with the words "Lifestyle Wollert" on a wall.

props.synopsis: Lifestyle Communities share price plunges more than 18 per cent in the wake of an ABC investigation detailing claims the operator of gated communities for the over 50s is gouging residents with unfair fees including charging the dead rent.

title.children: Investors slash more than $200 million from value of land lease operator after ABC investigation

image.altText: A screen shows the logo and a ticker symbol for The Walt Disney Company.

props.synopsis: Large swaths of data belonging to entertainment giant Disney appear to have been leaked online by a hacking group claiming to protect artists' rights.

title.children: Hacking group Nullbulge claims to have carried out major cyber attack on Disney

image.altText: Man and woman smiling, standing side by side in front of their home

props.synopsis: Data on property prices and regional migration shows Australians are once again moving out of the capital cities, with millennials leading the way. But the trend is pushing up property prices, in what experts are describing as a "boomerang" effect post-pandemic.

title.children: Escaping the rat race and rental rut of city life, millennials are on the move again

image.altText: An old photograph of a young man with olive skin, floppy brown hair and a beaming smile, sitting under a willow tree.

props.synopsis: Barry McCluskey was the first known Australian nurse to contract HIV, but he never let his illness define him.

title.children: In 1985, a newspaper outed Barry's HIV status in his regional town. It was the start of years of abuse

image.altText: A map of a green field with three social media posts falling on it. The largest says "Looking more and more like an inside job"

props.synopsis: Falsehoods about former US president Donald Trump's attempted assassination are spreading online faster than journalists can assemble an accurate account of what we know. ABC News Verify has assembled the key claims, and how they have gained traction.

title.children: These are some of the biggest false claims to emerge from Trump's attempted assassination

image.altText: A courthouse sketch of fourteen people sitting in a court gallery.

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Struhs, who was a type 1 diabetic, died in her Toowoomba home in January 2022 after she stopped receiving her insulin injections.

title.children: Father tells court son's views 'gradually became more and more extreme' after joining Toowoomba 'cult'

image.altText: An older man wearing a red tie, white shirt and a black suit jacket with a serious expression

props.synopsis: A US judge dismisses the criminal case accusing Donald Trump of illegally holding onto classified documents, handing the former president another major legal victory as the Republican seeks a return to the White House.

title.children: Judge tosses Trump documents case, ruling prosecutor unlawfully appointed

image.altText: Two men at a press conference

props.synopsis: Barry O'Rourke has admitted to using the electoral roll to find the addresses of people he says wrote abusive comments on his social media pages, claiming it led to "perfectly polite and friendly" discussions.

title.children: Queensland MP defends use of electoral roll to doorknock social media bullies

image.altText: Donald Trump raises his fist while surrounded by secret service agents.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump looks ever more likely to return to the White House and, while commentators focus on deep political and social divisions in the US, a Trump victory will also have far-reaching global economic and market ramifications.

title.children: Donald Trump wants to put tariffs of up to 60 per cent on Chinese goods. What will that do to the global economy?

image.altText: Ramon Jesurun

props.synopsis: Ramon Jesurun and his son were two of 27 people arrested during a Copa America final that was marred by crowd chaos in Miami on Monday.

title.children: Colombian soccer boss and son arrested over altercation with guards at Copa America final

image.altText: Ambulances wait as a plane lands on the road.

props.synopsis: Eyre Highway traffic had to queue twice in the space of a week as the Royal Flying Doctor Service touched down to retrieve patients.

title.children: Outback highway becomes runway for flying doctor's 'last resort' landings

image.altText: Construction of a high voltage power line in 2022

props.synopsis: While Australia debates the merits of going nuclear and frustration grows over the slower-than-needed switch to solar and wind power, China's renewables rollout is breaking all the records.

title.children: 'Winning the race': How China plans to meet its 2030 renewables target by the end of this month

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiling as an excited voter, a young woman, takes a selfie with him.

props.synopsis: The attempted assassination of Donald Trump has Australian politicians calling for a calming of public debates, amid fears attacks on elected figures here could see a greater need for police protection.

title.children: 'Uglier, more violent': Safety review for Australian politicians after Donald Trump assassination attempt

image.altText: A still from the movie Fly Me to the Moon with Scarlett Johansson and Channing Tatum in 50s clothes standing on a wooden bridge

props.synopsis: Scarlett Johansson plays a bright marketing expert, hired to make sure everyone knows the US put a man on the Moon, opposite Channing Tatum as NASA's launch director.

title.children: Scarlett Johansson stars in Fly Me to the Moon, a rom-com and a conspiracy thriller all at once

image.altText: Man in high vis jacket standing next a large fallen gumtree in wet weather

props.synopsis: The SES has received more than 300 calls for help after heavy rain in the past 24 hours, including from one resident whose house caved in on him when a gumtree fell.

title.children: Family trapped in home, vehicles stuck in floodwaters as heavy rain drenches Victoria

image.altText: Jeramiah Manele shakes hands with Xi Jinping standing in front of the flags of Solomon Islands and China

props.synopsis: Jeremiah Manele praised China and indicated his country was keen to extend security and policing partnerships with the regional power — but will his words translate to more deals?

title.children: On a trip to China, Solomon Islands' PM visited a shining example of Australia's concerns about Pacific security

image.altText: A video still of a tsunami wave coming over a wall and sending up a big spray of water. The blue ocean is in the background

props.synopsis: As the sun crested the horizon on Boxing Day 20 years ago, these Australians holidaying in Thailand had no idea their lives were about to be engulfed by chaos. This is what they remember about that day.

title.children: How the Boxing Day tsunami unfolded twenty years ago

image.altText: A close up of a woman in her early 40s, black background, lit from behind, staring determinedly

props.synopsis: Between a new stage play and book - Zinnie Harris's Macbeth (An Undoing) and Val McDermid’s Queen Macbeth - Lady M has finally gotten out of that damned spot.

title.children: Bloodthirsty, scheming, treacherous Lady Macbeth finally given some shades of grey in new works
